title: EUPRAXIA
content:
EUPRAXIA was the goddess or personified spirit (daimona) of good conduct.

Aeschylus, Seven Against Thebes 223 ff (trans. Weir Smyth) (Greek tragedy C5th B.C.)
          :
        "When you invoke the gods, do not be ill-advised. For Peitharkhia (Peitharchia, Obedience) is the mother of
        Eupraxia (Success), wife of Soter (Salvation)--as the saying goes."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
